contentInfo.title: Building a RAG application using open-source models (Asking questions from a PDF using Llama2)

experiments.title: Building a RAG application using open-source models (Asking questions from a PDF using Llama2)
experiments.description: This experiment focuses on developing a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system to enable natural language querying of PDF documents. It specifically leverages open-source models like Llama2 for generation, combined with vector embeddings and a vector database for efficient information retrieval from the PDF content.

tools.name: Llama2
tools.description: An open-source large language model developed by Meta, used as the core generation component in the RAG application to answer questions based on retrieved document chunks.
mentioned: Building a RAG application using open-source models (Asking questions from a PDF using Llama2)
tools.suggestedContext: Replicate (usage-based, $10-50/month for prototyping); Self-hosted on cloud GPU (e.g., AWS EC2, $70-360/month) for production

tools.name: ChromaDB
tools.description: Open-source embedding database for LLM applications

pricing.usage: Free to self-host, infrastructure costs only

allTiers.usage: Free to self-host, infrastructure costs only

tools.name: PDF Loader Library (e.g., unstructured.io, PyPDF2)
tools.description: A library or tool used to extract text and potentially other structured data from PDF documents, preparing the content for further processing, chunking, and embedding.
mentioned: Building a RAG application using open-source models (Asking questions from a PDF using Llama2)

tools.description: A platform for hosting Git repositories, enabling version control and collaborative development of the RAG application. The provided content points to a GitHub repository for this project.
